title: Vinotonus
text: Vinotonus is a god from <a href="Celtic%20mythology">Celtic mythology</a> of which little is known. Only four altars dedicated to Vinotonus have been found all of which are located near the <a href="Castra">Roman fort</a> at <a href="Bowes">Bowes</a>. The <a href="Ancient%20Rome">ancient Romans</a> found Vinotonus to be equivalent to <a href="Silvanus%20%28mythology%29">Silvanus</a>, the god of agriculture, and that he was a wilderness god. It was common for the Romans to assign the names of popular Roman gods to local Celtic deities as Silvanus was also equated with the Celtic god <a href="Cocidius">Cocidius</a>.
